name: Length scale factor in similar shapes 1

skills.name: Identify whether two shapes are similar or not
Solve length problems involving similar shapes where the missing length is the longer one
Solve length problems involving similar shapes where the missing length is the shorter one
Identify that a shape has been enlarged

explanations.A: If the shape is enlarged by a scale factor of 2, all of the lengths will be twice as long. This means that the perimeter will also be twice as long.
explanations.B: The perimeter is the sum of all the lengths. What happens if each side becomes two times as long? Try some numbers for the lengths and see what happens.
explanations.C: The perimeter is the sum of all the lengths. What happens if each side becomes two times as long? Try some numbers for the lengths and see what happens.
explanations.D: It looks like you have added to the perimeter rather than multiplying it by an amount.

explanations.A: If two objects are 'similar' they have the same shape. Can a circle be enlarged or shrunk to make any other circle?
explanations.B: If two triangles are 'similar' then corresponding angles are equal. Are all corresponding angles equal in different equilateral triangles?
explanations.C: If two objects are 'similar' then corresponding angles are equal. Not all rhombuses have the same corresponding angles.
explanations.D: If two objects are 'similar' then corresponding angles are equal and one shape is an enlargement of the other. Is this true for regular decagons?

explanations.B: What is the scale factor to get from 5 to 15? What do we multiply by? How can we use this to find the star?
